page.title: 12Summer Day on Bank of Avon
page.content:
I sat on the bank of the river Avon on a still summer day. The water is quite fast flowing and very clear and thick with water cress and about me fly many insects including mayfly, caddisfly and dragonflies. A brown trout ripples the surface near the middle of the stream rising to one of the many insects. I can see a water snail clinging to a plant and the shells of freshwater mussels and some I later identified as freshwater nerite and keeled ramshorn. All about me are wild flowers.The iris are over,but there is water mint purple -loosestrife and meadowsweet. A water vole scuttles into its hole in the bank and a sudden flash of blue reveals a kingfisher diving for its tea.
.
